item.title: Network architecture for servers, and Demilitarized zone (DMZ) (beta)
item.description: After you separate web servers from DBMS so you can configure and scale databases independently, you may want to place web servers in a different zone. A basic Firewall acts as a perimiter separating external network from internal network and filters traffic based on policies you set Creating a Demilitarized zone (DMZ) by adding another firewall insulating the intranet with databases from web servers between intranet and public internet is a well known approach for security.

item.title: Approaches for enterprise virtualization
item.description: this article is still being edited, visit later fore more detailed information history and use cases of virtualisation A hypervisor is the solution that allows virtual machines to share host resources. Virtualisation allows for running multiple operating systems on a single physical host. This helps enhancing server utilisation and management. Consilidation is sharing the resources of a (big) server by multiple virtual machines, leading to reduced cost Paravartualisation Paravirtualization is a technique to improve the performance, the guest operating system has support for paravirtualization to work more efficiently with the hypervisor with less overhead.

item.title: No USB drive? no problem, how to boot from ISO file on disk with GRUB2
item.description: Introduction In this post you will learn how to boot from an ISO file that exists on disk, without needing to burn CD or a USB. You need GRUB2 (version 1.97) or later to use this, GRUB legacy doesn’t support this feature To check what version of GRUB is installed: grub-install --version Adding a GRUB menu entry manually edit /etc/grub.d/40_custom Using grml-rescueboot First install grml-rescueboot using your distribution package manager

item.title: Commands that save much effort
item.description: Search in the contents of nested files: grep -rnw . -e "word to search for" | less in less text viewer, write /word and click enter to search for it, then use n to go for next occurance, Shift+n to go backwards, and q to exit Compile your markdown file to PDF with auto generated table of contents pandoc --pdf-engine=xelatex --toc -f markdown-implicit_figures --variable colorlinks=true input.md -o output.pdf Specifying engine for pandoc --pdf-engine=weasyprint can help you in certain cases

item.title: Level up your KVM storage management with these tricks
item.description: Change the size of a disk (be cautious) qemu-img resize /path/to/disk.qcow2 50G Check disk info including the size reserved on disk and virtual size qemu-img info /path/to/disk.qcow2 Make disk sparse (free space that is allocated to the host but not used), use only when the machine is shut down virt-sparsify --in-place /path/to/disk.qcow2 Convert format of the disk qemu-img convert /path/to/disk.qcow2 -O raw /another/path/disk.img Create a new virtual machine virt-install --name=VMNAME --memory=2048 --vcpus=1 --import --disk path=disk.

item.title: Tips for effective software test plans
item.description: start with a template containing; test case name: descriptive for anyone, write module name first at any format (between [] or <> ) steps: don’t write “repeat step x”, be clear, preconditions should be written before test case or in attached data expected results: not for every step but only when needed a good test case design will make a single step doesn’t block a whole case if it is irrelevant , maybe check general UI or do smoke test for blocker bugs first
